Candidates should verify details carefully and report discrepancies promptly. Multiple copies are advised, and Covid-19 protocols may apply at the exam centres.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/education/news/upsc-cse-main-2025-admit-card-out-at-upsc-gov-in-download-here-for-the-august-22-exam/articleshow/123305498.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/education/news/upsc-cse-main-2025-admit-card-out-at-upsc-gov-in-download-here-for-the-august-22-exam/articleshow/123305498.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 18:12:43 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SANJAY SHARMA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="112410" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123305448,imgsize-112410.cms"/></item><item><title>Israel-Gaza war: India reaffirms call for ceasefire, two-state solution</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/israel-gaza-war-india-reaffirms-call-for-ceasefire-two-state-solution-urges-uninterrupted-aid-supply/articleshow/123306088.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/israel-gaza-war-india-reaffirms-call-for-ceasefire-two-state-solution-urges-uninterrupted-aid-supply/articleshow/123306088.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 18:42:58 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="599882" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123306109,imgsize-599882.cms"/></item><item><title>'Little embarrassing': Jamie Dimon on US-China technology arms race</title><description><![CDATA[The Nvidia H20 chip sales to China are under scrutiny. Police have registered a case and are actively pursuing the accused, who face charges under the Atrocities Act.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/rajkot/dalit-man-attacked-for-sporting-moustache-beard/articleshow/123283294.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/rajkot/dalit-man-attacked-for-sporting-moustache-beard/articleshow/123283294.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 13:18:50 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="734104" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123299022,imgsize-734104.cms"/></item><item><title>75+ Happy Independence Day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2025</title><description><![CDATA[India will celebrate Independence Day on August 15, 2025. Failure to report may lead to notices for information mismatch and potential delays in refund processing.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/financial-literacy/taxation/itr-filing-fy-2024-25-dont-make-the-mistake-of-not-reporting-tax-exempt-incomes-such-as-ppf-gratuity-heres-why/articleshow/123299386.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/financial-literacy/taxation/itr-filing-fy-2024-25-dont-make-the-mistake-of-not-reporting-tax-exempt-incomes-such-as-ppf-gratuity-heres-why/articleshow/123299386.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 13:45:13 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="52098" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123299425,imgsize-52098.cms"/></item><item><title>Trump’s tariff fallout? Saaniya is an entrepreneur and animal welfare advocate, founding Mr. PAWS, a pet care brand.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/more-sports/my-plus-one-forever-arjun-tendulkars-fiances-adorable-pictures-with-sara-tendulkar-in-pics/articleshow/123299741.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/more-sports/my-plus-one-forever-arjun-tendulkars-fiances-adorable-pictures-with-sara-tendulkar-in-pics/articleshow/123299741.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 14:09:01 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="35910" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123299870,imgsize-35910.cms"/></item><item><title>Spotted! Deputy CM Ajit Pawar expressed discomfort, while the BJP pointed out the policy originated under Sharad Pawar's leadership.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/nashik/more-maharashtra-civic-bodies-order-closure-of-slaughterhouses-on-aug-15-chief-minister-fadnavis-says-govt-played-no-role/articleshow/123289673.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/nashik/more-maharashtra-civic-bodies-order-closure-of-slaughterhouses-on-aug-15-chief-minister-fadnavis-says-govt-played-no-role/articleshow/123289673.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 04:17:52 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="588601" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123294442,imgsize-588601.cms"/></item><item><title>Cricket's Rs 1,400cr question: Should India play Pakistan in the Asia Cup?</title><description><![CDATA[Pakistan’s latest meltdown against West Indies is another instance of their struggles across formats. The Asia Cup in UAE which could see them clash vs India thrice, provided both qualify for final, was meant to trigger hype and boost the broadcasters’ revenue. However, with Pakistan’s form and record vs India being so poor, one wonders how enthused cricket fans will be about what was a marquee match not too long ago]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/asia-cup/crickets-rs-1400-crore-question-should-india-even-play-pakistan-in-the-asia-cup/articleshow/123297833.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/asia-cup/crickets-rs-1400-crore-question-should-india-even-play-pakistan-in-the-asia-cup/articleshow/123297833.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 12:40:26 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>K SHRINIWAS RAO</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="101258" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123298172,imgsize-101258.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[India-China direct flights resumption likely to boost trade, tourism and economic ties]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/aviation/india-china-flights-resumption-economic-ties-impact-19653647.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[India and China are set to resume direct passenger flights after five years, a move expected to boost trade, tourism, and economic ties. The resumption comes amid growing diplomatic engagement, recent trade approvals, and ahead of Prime Minister Modi’s visit to China for the SCO Summit. Pre-pandemic, over 8 lakh passengers traveled annually between the two countries, with cargo flows also significant. Restoring direct flights is likely to reignite strong demand, supporting business, tourism, and people-to-people exchanges.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[On average in India, a senior First Officer earns about ₹5 lakh a month. At Emirates or Etihad, it’s ₹10 lakh rupees, tax-free, plus free housing and free schooling for up to 3 children. In the US, the same job can get you ₹17 lakh a month.       <description><![CDATA[Experts say proposed changes to the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code will only work if backed by a functional framework, not left to court-driven resolutions.       <title><![CDATA[Dashverse to invest $13 million Series A funding in AI R&D to build India’s leading creator ecosystem]]></title>

      <description><![CDATA[Dashverse, an AI-driven entertainment startup, is set to invest 60-70% of its recent $13 million Series A funding into advanced AI research and development. With its microdrama app Dashreels surpassing 5 million downloads in just a month and ranking third on the Google Play Store, the company aims to build India’s leading AI creator ecosystem. CEO Sanidhya Narain highlighted the goal of delivering seamless storytelling through AI, tackling challenges like character consistency. Beyond consumer apps, Dashverse also offers AI-powered tools to help creators produce serialised content, aiming to democratise content creation via a thriving two-sided marketplace.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[Poly Medicure has revised its FY26 revenue growth guidance to around 16%, down from an earlier estimate of 20%, citing a weak June quarter impacted by slower performance in Europe.       <description><![CDATA[At the operating level, EBITDA was up 8.8% to ₹350 crore in the second quarter of this fiscal over ₹321.5 crore in the corresponding period in the previous fiscal. Shares of Castrol India Ltd ended at ₹222.10, up by ₹2.60 or 1.18% on the BSE.]]></description>
